results.title: A Case of Diabetic Ketoacidosis in a Patient on an SGLT2 Inhibitor and a Ketogenic Diet: A Critical Trio Not to Be Missed
results.text_hl: A 47-year-old male with a history of poorly controlled T2DM on @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ and @CHEMICAL_empagliflozin @CHEMICAL_MESH:C570240 @@@empagliflozin@@@ presented to the emergency department (ED) with several days of @<m>DISEASE_Pharyngitis</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D010612 @@@pharyngitis@@@, @DISEASE_Dyspnea @DISEASE_MESH:D004417 @@@dyspnea@@@, @DISEASE_Vomiting @DISEASE_MESH:D014839 @@@emesis@@@, @DISEASE_Abdominal_Pain @DISEASE_MESH:D015746 @@@abdominal pain@@@, and @DISEASE_Anorexia @DISEASE_MESH:D000855 @@@anorexia@@@.

citations.NLM: Steinmetz-Wood S, Gilbert M, Menson K. A Case of Diabetic Ketoacidosis in a Patient on an SGLT2 Inhibitor and a Ketogenic Diet: A Critical Trio Not to Be Missed Case Rep Endocrinol. 2020;2020():8832833. PMID: 32855828
